PathOfBuilding.Notes:
Same Assassin Poison Blade Blast build that has been popular since Heist League. Got hit by damage nerf in Ultimatum that is about three gem levels worth of damage. The nerf is totally justified and the build is still very good. The build is both really good at bossing thanks to the poison ramping and pretty good for clear speed thanks to Plague Bearer (and Obliteration Wands). The build shines in both softcore SSF and normal league. The only unique that is so good that you might want to call it mandatory is the first Obliteration, which is pretty common and has a somewhat farmable Divination Card. The build is a good mix for clearspeed and endgame bossing (Invitations are especially easy on this build due to poison ramping from multiple targets.) I have played this build for several leagues and events, for any more questions hit me up on twitch.tv/manni2 or on my discord.
There is a leveling section first and then some notes on endgame gearing and variants. _______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Leveling
There are multiple good strategies that bring this build into maps efficiently, including Toxic Rain / Caustic Arrow, Chaos Slinger or Armageddon Brand.
I personally like to swap to Bladeblast as early as possible (level 28) and change to Poison scaling after Cruel Lab (lvl 50-55ish). I wouldn't bother scaling crit until Uber Lab, since you need Ungil's Harmony to make good use of it and that might take a while to find anyway.
My leveling plan:
Level 1 to 28: Stormblast Mine - Swift Assembly - (Added Lightning or Elemental Focus at lvl 18) Orb of Storms - Onslaught - Added Lightning Skitterbots - Herald of Thunder Flame Dash - Arcane Surge Smoke Mine
Make use of the Ring-Wand Recipes to create very strong damage wands. Magic Wand + Alteration + normal Sapphire or Topaz Ring to make a strong wand that requires level 8. Magic Wand + Alteration + rare Topaz Ring for even better wands that require lvl 20, you want to make two of those when you reach level 20 to have a very easy time for a couple acts.
Check the lvl 28 Tree in this pob
After Level 28: Bladefall - Faster Casting - Spell Cascade - (Unleash once you hit level 38) Blade Blast - Physical to Lightning - Controlled Destruction - Elemental Focus Skitterbots - Herald of Thunder Flame Dash - Arcane Surge Smoke Mine Wave of Conviction Conductivity
This setup is not going to feel great until Unleash (level 38), but gets the job done. Take Opportunistic in Normal Lab.
Check the Level 55 Tree in this pob
After Cruel Lab: Bladefall - Faster Casting - Spell Cascade - Unleash Bladeblast - Poison - Deadly Ailments - Unbound Ailments/Vile Toxins Blasphemy - Despair - Herald of Agony Plague Bearer - Increased AoE Flame Dash - Smoke Mine - Withering Step
At this point you want to respec some of the starting nodes we took for the lightning build, check the level 55 Poison Swap tree for how the tree should look now. Your recipe-crafted wands are now useless, so ideally you picked up two 'Pagan Wand' bases to equip. Even if they are white they are ok at this point. Learn to use Plague Bearer efficiently now. The Idea is to use Bladefall-Bladeblast for a pack or two until the Plague Bearer is maxed out, then activate Plague Bearer's damage effect (lasts 12 seconds) and activate Withering Step and Quicksilver and monsters should just die from walking through them.
For single target, alternate between casting Bladefall and Blade Blast. Use Withering step whenever you can to apply the wither debuff. If you are playing trade league, buy Obliterations as soon as you can - you will not regret it.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Ascendancy Order: Opportunistic - Noxious Strikes - Mistwalker - Toxic Delivery
Flasks: Life - Enduring Mana - Quartz - Silver - Quicksilver early on replace Silver with Diamond once you got both Uberlab (so crit is actually relevant now) and ideally have an Onslaught granting Abyss Jewel. replace Mana with Jade once you fixed the Mana sustain (see below) for suffixes you need Adrenaline, Heat, Staunching, Warding and Grounding. Unique Flasks are an option once you reach Ailment Immunity from gear (see below).
Crit and Perfect Agony: From my experience with the build, going Perfect Agony and scaling Crit Multiplier is not worth unless gear is really good and you don't mind losing a bunch of life. Damage should be sufficient without Perfect Agony. You still want to scale Crit Chance because of Toxic Delivery, which makes Ungil's Harmony a very powerful (and cheap) amulet. Ungil's and Diamond Flask is all the investment you need for ~70% crit chance.
Mana Sustain: To be able to drop the reliance on the mana flask, we'd have to scale up to around 100 Mana regen per second. There's a variety of options to achieve that, mostly some combination of gaining flat mana regen (Clarity and increasing your max Mana) and '% increased mana regen' (rolls on jewellery or the boot enchant.). Decreasing Mana cost also helps, options are using level 1 Bladefall (barely affects dps) and using Elreon benchcrafts (-7 to total Mana cost of non-channeling skills). Note that sustaining mana without flask is by no means necessary and can be stalled for quite a while.
Ailment Immunity: Ailment Immunity is relatively easy to achieve on this build. Benefits are 100% reliable immunity to especially shock and freeze aswell as opening up multiple flask suffixes, which allows for damage mods like cast speed or crit chance or using Unique Flasks. The 'Thick Skin' Clusters grants a total of 20% chance to avoid ailments, The 'Crystal Skin' cluster grants 50%. Benchcrafts on Body Armour grants up to 30% and on gloves/helmets we can get 25% each. Any combination that reaches at least 100% is fine, decide based on your gear.
Aura Setups: I heavily recommend Blasphemy Despair for the clearspeed it provides. Since we are mostly clearing with Plague Bearer, Curse on Hit wouldn't be applied to most monsters. Plague Bearer and Blasphemy radius are also about the same, so we basically boost Plague Bearer's dps constantly.
Mapping Auras: Blasphemy Despair - Flesh and Stone - Vitality/Clarity (Clarity if you are going for Mana regen instead of flask).
Bossing Auras: Flesh and Stone - Herald of Agony - Vitality/Clarity or Flesh and Stone - Malevolence (bad sustain but better damage)
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Gearing alternatives:
Weapons: Obliterations are king for map clear, no other options there. I recommend having a second set of weapons to change to for challenging bosses. Good and simple choice are Cold Iron Point Daggers, either two of them or one Cold Iron Point + Shield (Life, +1 Physical, Crit for spells, Cast speed etc.) A good rare item alternative to Cold Iron Points is a wand with some of these mods (Pagan Wand base ideally): - +1 to Physical Spells or All Spells - Chaos Dot Multiplier - Dot Multiplier - Crit Chance for Spells - Cast Speed - %increased Chaos damage veiled mod
Helmet: An Endgame option for the helmet would be an Elder Helmet with 'socketed skills are supported by concentrated effect' to put the Bladefall 4-link in there. Best enchant is probably 'Blade Blast has increased AoE'
Body Armour: Carcass Jack is amazing for clear speed because it increases Plague Bearer and Obliteration AoE. Kintsugi or a big life/resist rare are good alternatives.
Amulet: Note that Ungil's Harmony is only good once you actually have all ascendancy points for the build. A rare amulet can potentially beat Ungil's, but is magnitude more expensive.
Boots: Atziri's Step are hard to beat since we are scaling a lot of Dodge already. Well rolled Tailwind Boots are arguably better.
Clusters: Overwhelming Malice is a crazy good Cluster notable and is worth 5-6 points on its own. The simple option is to go for a medium Crit Cluster to get Overwhelming Malice and any decent second notable. Large Chaos is the second option for Overwhelming Malice. Much harder to roll and requires two good medium clusters ontop to make it worth.
For small clusters, I heavily recommend Enduring Composure because it combos really well with Immortal Call. Elegant Form for 30% avoid chance is another good option.
